# Crime Listing (Prospect Sector) These are the only crimes recognized aboard Prospect Sector. They are designed for survival-based gameplay, expedition safety, and maintaining a cooperative environment.
Crimes are categorized based on severity and type. All punishments remain **non-punitive** (warnings, demotions, confiscation, relocation).
------------------------------------------------------------- [color=#a4885c]## Violent Crimes[/color] -------------------------------------------------------------
1-01: Murder Killing another player intentionally without valid escalation or self-defense.
1-02: Attempted Murder Actions clearly intended to kill: multiple lethal attacks, trapping someone in a deadly environment, or using expedition weapons on crew.
1-03: Manslaughter Causing death through reckless behavior, extreme negligence, or misuse of hazardous equipment.
1-04: Severe Assault Inflicting major injury with weapons or dangerous tools outside reasonable escalation.
------------------------------------------------------------- [color=#a4885c]## Dangerous Equipment Misuse[/color] -------------------------------------------------------------
Crime Description
2-01
Unauthorized Expedition Gear Display: Carrying visible dangerous weapons/armor outside the Terradrop zone without an active emergency.
2-02
Reckless Use of Hazardous Tools: Using dangerous equipment in a way that endangers crew or damages station areas.
2-03
Unsafe Projectile/Explosive Use: Firing weapons or using explosives in station areas without emergency justification.
------------------------------------------------------------- [color=#a4885c]## Tampering, Theft, and Sabotage[/color] -------------------------------------------------------------
3-01: Grand Theft (Expedition Critical) Theft of essential expedition gear, Terradrop components, reactor systems, medical lifesaving equipment, or major departmental tools.
3-02: Sabotage of Life-Critical Systems Disabling atmos, power, Terradrop components, life support, or survival-essential comms.
3-03: Sabotage of Expedition Operations Tampering with suits, supplies, Terradrop loading, or gear required for expedition survival.
3-04: High-Risk Trespass Entering restricted areas (reactor, atmos, Terradrop internals, command offices) in a way that threatens safety.
------------------------------------------------------------- [color=#a4885c]## Kidnapping, Restraint, and Detainment[/color] -------------------------------------------------------------
Crime Description
4-01
Kidnapping / Non-Emergency Detainment: Restricting or isolating someone without escalation, consent, or immediate safety need.
4-02
Abuse of Restraints: Keeping someone restrained after the threat has ended.
------------------------------------------------------------- [color=#a4885c]## Grave Risk Crimes[/color] -------------------------------------------------------------
5-01: Prevention of Revival Hiding, spacing, or destroying bodies in a way that prevents medical recovery.
5-02: Station-Wide Destruction Catastrophic harmful actions: large-scale venting, mass power sabotage, or triggering hazardous devices without emergency need.
------------------------------------------------------------- [color=#a4885c]## Contraband (Expedition Context Only)[color] -------------------------------------------------------------
Code Description
6-01
Prohibited Hazard Transport: Bringing extremely dangerous expedition items into civilian areas.
6-02
Concealed Hazardous Storage: Hiding dangerous gear where untrained crew may find or misuse it.
------------------------------------------------------------- [color=#a4885c]## Notes[/color] ------------------------------------------------------------- - These crimes are **roleplay tools**, not punishments. - Only temporary containment, demotion, confiscation, or relocation are allowed. - There is no brig, execution, or long-term imprisonment. - Escalation rules and RP context always take priority. - Command determines relevance through IC judgment.
